metadata.title: CVE-2019-14295 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An Integer overflow in the getElfSections function in p_vmlinx.cpp in UPX3.95 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via askewed offset larger than the size of the PE section in a UPX packedexecutable, which triggers an allocation of excessive memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14295` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

upx-ucl - 3.95-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: upx-ucl package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.95-2').
